title: KPI Dashboard for Operations Monitoring

problem.description: The company managed operational KPIs through Excel files shared via email, with data manually extracted from 3 different systems. The process required 2 days/week and data was often outdated or inconsistent.
painPoints: Manual reports required 2 days of work per week
Outdated data by distribution time (48h delay)
Transcription errors and corrupted Excel formulas

technical: Integration with legacy ERP without documented APIs
No direct access to production database
compliance: Sensitive business data, no public cloud

solution.architecture: Self-hosted dashboard with daily ETL from 3 data sources. Python for ingestion, PostgreSQL for storage, Metabase for visualization. Deployed on client's on-premise VM.
keyDecisions: Metabase instead of custom solutions to reduce maintenance
Nightly scheduled ETL to minimize impact on production systems
CSV export from legacy ERP instead of screen scraping (more stable)
PostgreSQL on Docker to simplify backups and migrations
solution.approach: Iterative: first ETL for most critical data source, then progressive addition of others. Dashboard co-designed with stakeholders through weekly reviews.

metrics.label: Data freshness
metrics.description: Nightly ETL with previous day data

results.impact: The ops team recovered 2 days/week of manual work, now dedicated to analysis instead of data entry. Managers have real-time access to KPIs and can make faster decisions.

role: Analysis of existing systems and data source mapping
Architecture design and tech stack selection
Documentation and handover to IT team
